intro: Leutea elbursensis, commonly known as the Elburs stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the Elburs Mountains in Iran. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually blue-green in color and can store water efficiently. Leutea elbursensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited geographic distribution.
